s16: Lü Buwei was chancellor to King Zhuangxiang of Qin, and also looked up to revere antiquity, edited and collected from the Spring and Autumn Annals, gathered events from the time of the six states, making them into eight surveys, six discussions, and twelve records, calling it the Lü Family Spring and Autumn Annals.
s17: And like Xun Qing, Mencius, Gongsun Gu, and Han Fei and their followers, each collected fragments from the Spring and Autumn Annals' text to write books, differing greatly in their accounts.
s18: The Han chancellor Zhang Cang calendared the five virtues, the senior grand master Dong Zhongshu expounded the Spring and Autumn Annals' principles, and wrote quite extensively about them.
